name: Tict
description: The Technology Impact Cycle Tool helps you to estimate the impact of (new) technology! This tool does that by asking questions. By answering the questions you will gain insight into a lot of facets that are involved in determining the impact of technology. This tool will not tell you what is right or wrong or better. It will help you think about the impact of a (new) technology by asking the right questions so you can make better decisions.

name: Gym-Shift
description: Your Ultimate Fitness Companion! Elevate your fitness journey with the power of personalized workouts. Unleash the full potential of your workouts as you craft your unique exercise schemes and tailor them to your goals.
design_description: When I started working out, I was assigned several workout plans via the gym's own app by the trainers at the gym. After using the app for a short time, I quickly started thinking about improvements, until at one point I decided that I wanted to make my own gym app.

designing.paragraph: Because I was already using the gym's fitness app, I had a bit of an idea of how I wanted the layout to look; simple and easy to use for anyone who goes to the gym. That's why I chose to go with a Material UI style, which gives you simple icons that immediately make it clear what they do without taking up too much space on the screen.

user_tests.name: Ruben
user_tests.review: When you try to add an exercise to a workout, the scroll bar is in the buttons with the plus sign. The list of exercises doesn't fully show, so some buttons are not completely visible on my screen. Besides that, I haven't noticed anything else â€“ it's really well done, works easily and quickly.

user_tests.name: Charlotte
user_tests.review: Clear app, the workouts you can choose have an explanation of how to perform them, which is very helpful for beginners. Everything is clearly indicated, and the login screen was also easy to use. Additionally, it would be nice to customize your avatar, add images to the workouts, include information about which muscle groups you are targeting, be able to adjust the number of reps, and add deload sets and warming up.
